documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
dinarily say that a person acts selfishly if
she is too much concerned with her own interests at the expense of the in-
terests of others. On this standard use of the word “selfish,” there are any
number of counterexamples to the claim that all human actions are selfish.
But these counterexamples do not apply when the word “selfish” is used in
a new way, where “acting selfishly” comes close to meaning just “acting.”
The point is that under this new meaning of “selfish,” it becomes empty (or
almo
